header_summary:
Antoine Poinsot emphasized the intricacies within Bitcoin's multiparty transaction protocols, highlighting the balance between security and functionality in the face of non-standard inputs and the introduction of new transaction limits. This nuance is crucial for understanding the evolution of Bitcoin's transaction handling rules, particularly in mitigating edge cases while preserving network robustness ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/49dyqqkf5NqGlGdinp6SELIoxzE_ONh3UIj6-EB8S804Id5yROq-b1uGK8DUru66eIlWuhb5R3nhRRutwuYjemiuOOBS2FQ4KWDnEh0wLuA=@protonmail.com/T/#m6bb53227b0fc33fe8e3f962df7f8ca6143c258d6)).

Conduition's analysis delves into the challenges of integrating new signature algorithms like P256 into Bitcoin, considering the evolving focus towards post-quantum cryptographic solutions and the potential obsolescence posed by quantum computing advancements. The discussion also critiques the compatibility of WebAuthn with Bitcoin's security and user autonomy requirements, suggesting a complex pathway for its integration ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/GVA2lG8TET5qUPOU8JlHttBNLbTskqr_dbhzK9aOe_ZsPsNDyk2kWIPwmx3ngTchlGrsAIpubrVl24qmyqVgBvrZ8FT0POeomam2qB6-cqk=@proton.me/T/#mb4648d11e6487def3a9204054abf8fe08f23543a)).

Tim Ruffing's review of research on Bitcoin's Taproot post-quantum security reveals a significant safeguard against quantum attacks, proposing a softfork upgrade path to incorporate post-quantum signatures. This strategy underscores the importance of preemptive measures against both quantum and classical computational threats to Bitcoin's security ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/bee6b897379b9ae0c3d48f53d40a6d70fe7915f0.camel@real-or-random.org/T/#u#m92bcdcb0b0b26ea0138d2e09b8c1d2bbbc3eccb3)).

A [new paper](https://x.com/hashdag/status/1933544298810622335) introduced by zawy proposes an alternative blockchain consensus mechanism via "merge mining," using global computational power for matrix multiplication. This approach suggests a shift from the energy-intensive Proof of Work to a more efficient and secure model, challenging the traditional paradigms of blockchain security and efficiency. Concurrently, the release of a new dataset and benchmarking tool by zpv for Bitcoin block fee spans and estimations, available at [GitHub](https://github.com/block/bitcoin-augur-benchmarking), marks a step towards enhancing research and analysis within the cryptocurrency domain.

recent_posts.title: Make pathological transactions with more than 2500 legacy signature operations non-standard
recent_posts.summary:
- Antoine clarifies non-standard inputs in Bitcoin protocols aren't attacks but design choices.
- He differentiates new limits affecting legacy inputs, not Segwit in recent tests.
- The new limit targets potentially problematic transactions, enhancing network robustness.

recent_posts.title: Revisiting secp256r1 signatures (i.e. P256, mobile HSM support)
recent_posts.summary:
- Integrating new signature algorithm P256 into Bitcoin involves years of community consensus and development.
- The relevance of P256 may diminish due to emerging quantum-resistant technologies and quicker advancements.
- Adapting WebAuthn for Bitcoin faces issues with user autonomy, deterministic backups, and compatibility with existing standards.

recent_posts.title: Taproot is post-quantum secure when restricted to script-path spends
recent_posts.summary:
- Research shows Bitcoin's Taproot secure against quantum attacks through script-path spending.
- Two-phase softfork upgrade improves Bitcoin's post-quantum security, following paper's suggestions.
- Despite quantum challenges, classical computing poses a greater risk to Taproot's security.

recent_posts.title: New paper on Proof of Usable Work
recent_posts.summary:
- A new paper proposes using global matrix multiplication power for merging mining a blockchain.
- It introduces a Proof of Useful Work (PoUW) model for secure, efficient consensus without wasteful energy.
- This model could shift cryptocurrency mining towards productive tasks, linking coin issuance to computational work.

recent_posts.title: Augur: Block’s Open Source Bitcoin Fee Estimation Library
recent_posts.summary:
- A new dataset and benchmarking tool for Bitcoin fee estimation has been released.
- The dataset covers data from January 2025 to June 2025, aiding various cryptocurrency stakeholders.
- It aims to promote transparency and collaboration, with resources available on GitHub.

recent_posts.title: Disclosure: LND gossip_timestamp_filter DoS
recent_posts.summary:
- The email addresses a failed security mitigation on the Lightning Network.
- A GitHub commit revealed the method could be bypassed using multiple node IDs.
- The sender openly acknowledges their error, highlighting the value of transparency in development.

active_posts.title: A Post Quantum Migration Proposal
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal advocates for Bitcoin's transition to quantum-resistant cryptography due to quantum computing threats.
- It outlines a phased approach, including a new post-quantum output type (P2QRH) and deadlines for abandoning legacy signatures.
- Aimed at protecting Bitcoin's value, it requires stakeholder action and offers a soft fork strategy for backward compatibility.

active_posts.title: Human meaningful witness versioning
active_posts.summary:
- Ava Chow proposes mnemonic-based Witness Version allocation to enhance Bitcoin clarity.
- The proposal aims to improve user understanding and safety in cryptocurrency transactions.
- It suggests replacing numeric sequence with mnemonic significance for version identification.

active_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Proof-of-Activity Reclamation (PoAR)
active_posts.summary:
- Donald Dienst introduced a Bitcoin Improvement Proposal titled "Proof-of-Activity Reclamation (PoAR)." - PoAR aims to recycle inactive coins for over twenty years back into circulation, preserving miner incentives.
- The proposal details are on GitHub for community feedback and collaboration.

active_posts.title: Changes to BIP-360 - Pay to Quantum Resistant Hash (P2QRH)
active_posts.summary:
- BIP-360 modifications enhance Bitcoin's defense against quantum threats by adopting P2TR.
- The approach simplifies implementation and avoids pressing quantum attack adjustments.
- It outlines a forward-looking plan for Post-Quantum signature integration separate from BIP-360.

active_posts.title: Exploring Extended Relative Timelocks
active_posts.summary:
- The discussion explores extending Bitcoin timelocks to ~10 years, prompted by user feedback.
- A proposed method suggests using bit 21 in `nSequence` for longer timelocks, multiplying duration by 8.
- The initiative includes a tool for testing extended timelocks, with code and tool links provided for review.

active_posts.title: Where does the 33.33% threshold for selfish mining come from?
active_posts.summary:
- Selfish mining critically analyzed from a 2013 study, focusing on unfair block contribution.
- Profitability of selfish mining depends on hashrate and block propagation speed.
- Study concludes selfish mining advantageous when hashrate exceeds one-third of network.

today_in_history_posts.title: BIP174 extension proposal (Global Type: PSBT_GLOBAL_XPUB_SIGNATURE)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Jonathan Underwood discusses secure signing in multisig on GitHub.
- He proposes explicit signing for security, contrasting Dmitry Petukhov's suggestions.
- Underwood, Bitbank's Chief Bitcoin Officer, shares his public key for encryption.

today_in_history_posts.title: Trampoline Routing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Trampoline routing lets users defer payment route calculations using trampoline nodes in lightning networks.
- It involves Alice sending a payment through nodes until it reaches Bob, focusing on fee and cltv adjustments.
- The system adapts existing infrastructure for fee exchange, enhancing ease of use and reliability at a cost.

today_in_history_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Investment strategies are divided into passive and active categories.
- Passive investment's drawbacks include the principal/agent problem and potential underutilization of assets.
- The article suggests central banks could stabilize economies using currencies backed by deflationary ones like Bitcoin.
